title.rendered: Full List of Records Broken During SRH vs MI in IPL 2024.

content.rendered:
The Indian Premier League 2024 match between Sunrisers Hyderabad (SRH) and Mumbai Indians (MI) at the Rajiv Gandhi International Stadium on March 27 (Wednesday) was a big-hitting affair. In the end, SRH’s run tally was higher than that of MI who won by 31 runs. There are plenty of these records that are planted during IPL 2024 number 8 matches.

Srh beats the first and the competition and up to 277/3/3 and 20 and 20 and 20 and 20 and 2 centuries of the Travi and Heinrich Klaan Klaan. In reply, MI got off to a good start thanks to Tilak Varma’s half-century which kept them in the game, but eventually fell short despite Tim David’s scoreless 42* off 22.

Complete list of records broken in IPL 2024 SRH vs MI

Highest team total in IPL

277/3 – SRH vs MI on March 2024

263/5 – RCB vs Pune Warriors India in April 2013

257/5 – LSG vs PBKS on April 2023

248/3 – RCB v Gujarat Lions in May 2016

246/5 ​​- CSK vs RR in April 2010

246/5 ​​– MI vs SRH in March 2024

Highest total in T20s

523 runs – SRH vs MI in March 2024

517 – West Indies vs South Africa in March 2023

515 – Gladiators vs. Sultans in March 2023

506 – Surrey v Middlesex in June 2023

501 – Titans vs Knights in October 2022

Most sixes in T20 matches

38 sixes – SRH vs MI, IPL 2024

37 sixes – Balkh Legends vs Kabul Zwanan, Afghanistan Premier League 2018

37 sixes – St Kitts & Nevis Patriots v Jamaica Tallawahs, Caribbean Premier League 2019

33 sixes (best in IPL)

Highest score for a team in Indian Premier League Run Chase

MI made a score of 246/5, which turned out to be not only the highest total in the chase but also the highest number of chases made by a team in the history of the tournament, even if It was a loss. The previous highest score by a team chasing total in IPL was 226, made by Rajasthan Royals against Punjab Kings in IPL 2020.

Maximum score in an IPL match

The 69 hits in the SRH vs MI match is the highest score in an IPL match. He set the record during CSK vs RR in Chennai during IPL 2010.

Most balls conceded on Indian Premier League debut

Kwena Maphaka, a 17-year-old MI recruit, conceded 66 runs in his four years, to break the record for the most runs scored on his IPL debut. Michael Neser against the Royal Challengers in 2013 conceded 62. This is also the third most expensive spell by a bowler in the IPL game.

Fastest Fifties by an SRH Batter

Abhishek Sharma reached in 16 balls. The record was set earlier in the game by Travis Head, who achieved it with 18 balls.

Highest Powerplay Total SRH

SRH amassed 81 runs at the end of the power play against MI, their highest in the IPL. The previous record was 79 runs against KKR in 2017.

Read Also: IPL 2024 Opening Ceremony: Akshay Kumar and Tiger Shroff give an electric performance
